content.title: Micro Credit Finance under NSKFDC- Haryana
content.department: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC)
content.details: The scheme 'Micro Credit Finance under NSKFDC' is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC). The HSFDC is a Company registered under the Companies Act, 1956 on 02.01.1971. It is a wholly Government-owned Corporation with a 51% share of the State Government and a 49% share of the Government of India. Under this scheme, the loan is provided to Safai Karamchari and their dependents for projects with a maximum cost of up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiary for small and petty trade/business and various income-generating activities. The beneficiary should be between 18 and 55 years of age and should be either Safai Karamchari or his/her dependent, and permanent Safai Karamchari means a person engaged in, or employed for any sanitation work and includes his dependents.
benefits: Loan amount up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiary for small and petty trade/business
Margin money @ 10% of the project cost
Subsidy @ 50% of the total project cost (Maximum subsidy amount is ₹10,000/-)
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant's age should be between 18 and 55 years.
The applicant should be either Safai Karamchari or his/her dependent.
documents_required: Safai Karamchari or dependent of Safai Karamchari Certificate issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: Who implements the Micro Credit Finance scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC).

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the loan under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Haryana aged between 18 and 55 who are either Safai Karamcharis or their dependents.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount is ₹1,00,000 per beneficiary.

faqs.question: What types of activities can the loan be used for?
faqs.answer: The loan can be used for small trades, businesses, and various income-generating activities.

faqs.question: Is there a margin money requirement for the loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, the corporation provides margin money at 10% of the project cost.

faqs.question: Is there a subsidy provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a subsidy of 50% of the total project cost, up to a maximum of ₹10,000, is provided to beneficiaries living below the poverty line.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for applicants.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the official HSFDC website or the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: What is the process after applying for the loan?
faqs.answer: Applications are scrutinized and verified by District Managers. Eligible cases are sent to NSKFDC for loan sanction, followed by the issuance of the requisite sanction.

faqs.question: What does 'permanent Safai Karamchari' mean?
faqs.answer: It refers to a person engaged in or employed for sanitation work, including their dependents.
